intro: Quassia subcymosa, commonly known as the African quassia, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
